DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number that represents the concentration of the compound measured in micromoles.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight._The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight.

Concepts.definition: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

Concepts.definition: The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support CTD2 activity per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/28/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A measured numerical quantity that represents the concentration of the compound in micromoles.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
